intro: Minuartia hirsuta var. longipetala, commonly known as the long-petaled sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit and small, delicate leaves. The flowers are typically pink or white, with long, slender petals that distinguish this variety from others in the species. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. This plant plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas.
